> I assume that if I looked at the formater output from a test like this I would
> see the same test name / test method name repeated once for each iteration.

That's what happens when you don't fail your test to see if the output 
helps you or not...  (And that's why I don't like the implementation of 
  assertTrue, assertFalse).

> While I have seen the API javadoc on the setName() method, I do not understand
> it, nor do I know if it would affect the formatter output.

the setName method was introduce so that you don't have to write the 
famous String constructor (MyTest(String name)...) over and over again.

> I would _really_
> like to read in the name  I want for a test along with the test data (in the
> one-time test suite setup() I think), and have a way to dynamically set the
> method name (or test name), so I would see a useful list of tests in the
> formatter output.

The solution is trivial: overwrite the getName() method (and return the 
name of the method along with other useful data).

-Vladimir
